text: Bomarea uncifolia is a species of plant in the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. It is threatened by habitat loss.Mogollón, H. & Pitman, N. 2003. Bomarea uncifolia. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2003. Downloaded on 10 September 2015. ==References== uncifolia Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
